text: In addition, these data implied that, 1) CEACAM genes originated before the evolution of cartilaginous fish, 2) mammalian CEACAM/PSG genes evolve from one or two ancestral genes that were located adjacent to ATP1A3, ZNF574, PAFAH1B3, CNFN, LIPE, TOMM40, and APOE in the MRCA of teleost fish and tetrapods (Fig. S3 in File S1), and 3) CEACAM/PSG genes belong to an independent branch of the immunoglobulin superfamily that evolved in parallel with BCRs, TCRs, and FcRc receptors early in vertebrates.
